page.title: 20SCHOOLS:S.E. of Huddersfield
page.content: There are twelve schools in our area, the smallest of 104 pupils and the largest of 850. There are two {Roman Catholic}schools and one{Church {of England}school. All of the schools are{comprehensive, mixed schools.}The oldest was given its charter in 1608, and the newest schools were built in the 1970s. One school was used for housing soldiers during World War Two. Another is a purpose built Middle School. The smallest has six classrooms and five teachers; the largest includes laboratories, workshops, has fifty teachers and a swimming pool on site. Five schools worked together on the Domesday Project in this survey area. They are{Longcroft Juniors, Dalton {Juniors, Moldgreen Juniors, St {Joseph's Juniors and Lepton Middle {School.}We have enjoyed the project.
